posts.title: Hike the Andes to reach Incan ruins of Machu Picchu, Peru
posts.body: The Inca archaeological ruin of Machu Picchu is one of the Seven Wonders of the world. The trail is 4-day long taking you through some of country’s most beautiful landscapes.

posts.title: Ride hot-air balloon in Cappadocia, Turkey
posts.body: The hot air balloon ride in Cappadocia is among major tourist attractions of Turkey. The ride takes you above a volcanic landscape and pleases you with golden sunset.

posts.title: Release the lanterns in Yi Peng Festival, Thailand
posts.body: Yi Peng Festival or the Lantern Festival is an important time of the year. Locals return to their home to celebrate this day with their families. They decorate houses and streets, and release sky lanterns, which is symbolic of letting go all the misfortunes.

posts.title: Enjoy a hot spring bath in Blue Lagoon, Iceland
posts.body: The geothermal spa, Blue Lagoon, is located in a lava field. With steam released from its blue waters, it looks nothing less than a dream paradise.

posts.title: Behold the Northern Lights from Glass Igloo in Finland
posts.body: Northern Lights obviously is found in many people’s bucket list, but watching Aurora Borealis right from the comfort of your bed, in a luxurious glass igloo is an experience to cherish!

posts.title: Spend nights with the penguins in Antarctica’s Emperor Camp
posts.body: Who doesn’t want to visit Antarctica?! The cherry of the top is added when you’re spending nights in the camps amidst several friendly emperor penguins.

posts.title: Go glamping and wildlife viewing in Masai Mara, Kenya
posts.body: Kenya is considered the pilgrim for wildlife lovers. Right from game viewing to luxurious glamping experiences, you have everything sorted if you are a wild child!

posts.title: Scale the highest peak in the world – Mount Everest, Nepal
posts.body: You must have hiked all your life, but have you thought of reaching the peak of world’s tallest peak? Well if you haven’t, consider it the milestone! But make sure you have sufficient experience and are guided by an expert on your expedition.

posts.title: Celebrate La Tomatina in Spain
posts.body: After ZNMD, our travel goals have found a true meaning. People smash tomatoes around like crazy and then head to the bars for an after party. This festival takes place on the last wednesday of August in Valencian town of Buñol.

posts.title: Walk the Great Wall of China
posts.body: The Great Wall of China is in fact one of world’s most talked-about tourist attraction. And to walk through the Wall isn’t suggested because of its hype. There are different regions, most of which aren’t even known to tourists, which you can explore and where you can indulge in various amazing adventure.

posts.title: Walk on the salt flats of Salar de Uyuni, Bolivia
posts.body: Often mistaken to be an optical illusion, the salt flats of Salar de Uyuni is world’s largest salt flat that’s spread across an area of 10,582 square kilometers.

posts.title: Glance at the Pyramids of Giza, Egypt
posts.body: The Egyptian pyramids have the power to move you with its secrets and history. There is so much to learn about the history, each of the aspect is intriguing in every sense.
